item.title: Seriously the Best Vegetable Soup
item.description: This vegetable soup is not just any soup; it's a comforting bowl of warmth filled with vibrant, healthy vegetables. Perfect for chilly evenings, it's both nourishing and satisfying, making it a go-to recipe for any season. | ⏱️ Prep: 15min | Cook: 35min | Serves: 8 | #cat1761230166734 #easyrecipe #1hourmeals #recipe #cooking
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 35 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 50 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 8

📊 Difficulty: Easy

🥘 Ingredients

  • 4 cups vegetable broth
  • 2 cups chopped carrots
  • 2 cups chopped celery
  • 1 cup diced potatoes
  • 1 cup chopped onions
  • 2 cups chopped tomatoes
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 1 teaspoon dried thyme
  • Salt and pepper to taste

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
  2. Add onions, carrots, and celery; sauté for 5 minutes until softened.
  3. Stir in the potatoes and tomatoes, then add the vegetable broth.
  4. Season with thyme, salt, and pepper; bring to a boil.
  5. Reduce heat and simmer for 25 minutes until vegetables are tender.

item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 30 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 45 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 4

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 2 pounds fresh tomatoes, halved
  • 4 cloves garlic, unpeeled
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
  • 1 cup heavy cream
  • Fresh basil for garnish

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
  2. Place the halved tomatoes and unpeeled garlic on a baking sheet, drizzle with olive oil, and season with salt and pepper.
  3. Roast in the oven for 25-30 minutes until the tomatoes are caramelized.
  4. Let the tomatoes and garlic cool slightly, then peel the garlic.
  5. In a blender, combine the roasted tomatoes, garlic, and heavy cream, and blend until smooth.
  6. Heat the soup in a pot over medium heat until warmed through, then serve garnished with fresh basil.

⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 30 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 45 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 8

📊 Difficulty: Easy

🥘 Ingredients

  • 2 pounds carrots, peeled and chopped
  • 1 onion, chopped
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 4 cups vegetable broth
  • 1 cup heavy cream
  • Salt and pepper to taste

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onions and sauté until translucent.
  2. Add the chopped carrots and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until carrots are tender, about 20 minutes.
  3. Using an immersion blender, puree the soup until smooth. Stir in the heavy cream and season with salt and pepper.

With gooey cheese and a golden crust, they are sure to be a hit at any gathering. | ⏱️ Prep: 15min | Cook: 20min | Serves: 6 | #cat1761230383494 #easyrecipe #1hourmeals #recipe #cooking
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 20 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 35 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 6

📊 Difficulty: Easy

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 lb ground beef
  • 1 tsp garlic powder
  • 1 tsp onion powder
  • Salt & pepper, to taste
  • 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
  • 1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
  • 1 package refrigerated pizza dough
  • 2 Tbsp butter, melted
  • 1 clove garlic, minced

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C) or according to your dough package.
  2. Cook beef in a skillet until browned. Season with garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper. Drain excess grease.
  3. Roll out pizza dough on a floured surface. Sprinkle cheddar evenly across.
  4. Spoon beef over cheddar, then sprinkle mozzarella on top.
  5. Roll dough into a log, pinching seam to seal.
  6. Brush with melted garlic butter.
  7. Place seam-side down on a baking sheet lined with parchment.
  8. Bake 18–20 minutes, until golden. Rest 5 minutes, then slice and serve hot.

⏰ Total Time: 45 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 4

📊 Difficulty: Easy

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 pound shrimp peeled and deveined
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil
  • 4 cloves garlic minced
  • 1 teaspoon red pepper flakes
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Fresh parsley for garnish

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium heat.
  2. Add minced garlic and red pepper flakes, sauté for 1 minute until fragrant.
  3. Add shrimp and cook 2-3 minutes per side until pink and opaque.
  4. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  5. Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 30 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 45 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 8

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 2 cups cooked chicken, shredded
  • 8 flour tortillas
  • 2 cups sour cream
  • 1 cup shredded cheese
  • 1 can green chilies
  • 1 teaspoon garlic powder
  • 1 teaspoon onion powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C).
  2. In a bowl, mix shredded chicken, green chilies, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper.
  3. Fill each tortilla with the chicken mixture, roll them up, and place them seam-side down in a baking dish.
  4. In another bowl, combine sour cream and half of the shredded cheese, then pour over the enchiladas.
  5. Sprinkle the remaining cheese on top and bake for 25-30 minutes until bubbly and golden.

item.description: Embrace the flavors of fall with this hearty and comforting wild rice soup. Perfect for chilly evenings, it combines butternut squash, mushrooms, and a touch of autumn spice to warm your soul. | ⏱️ Prep: 15min | Cook: 90min | Serves: 6 | #cat1761230166734 #mediumrecipe #recipe #cooking #foodie
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 90 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 105 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 6

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 cup wild rice
  • 4 cups vegetable broth
  • 1 medium butternut squash, peeled and diced
  • 1 cup mushrooms, sliced
  • 1 onion, chopped
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 1 teaspoon dried thyme
  • 1 teaspoon dried sage
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 tablespoons olive oil

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, sauté until softened.
  2. Add butternut squash and mushrooms, cooking for about 5 minutes until they begin to soften.
  3. Stir in wild rice, vegetable broth, thyme, sage, salt, and pepper.
  4. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for about 1 hour, or until rice is tender.
  5. Adjust seasoning as needed and serve warm.

item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 30 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 45 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 4

📊 Difficulty: Easy

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 pound mushrooms, sliced
  • 2 tablespoons butter
  • 1 onion, chopped
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 4 cups vegetable broth
  • 1 cup heavy cream
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Fresh parsley for garnish

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. In a large pot, melt butter over medium heat. Add onions and garlic, sauté until translucent.
  2. Add sliced mushrooms and cook until they release their juices, about 5 minutes.
  3. Pour in the vegetable broth and bring to a simmer. Cook for 15 minutes.
  4. Stir in the heavy cream, season with salt and pepper, and blend until smooth.
  5. Serve hot, garnished with fresh parsley.

  • 1 cup heavy cream

  4. Stir in heavy cream and shredded cheese, mixing until melted and creamy. Season with salt and pepper.

  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 2 shallots, sliced

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Soak rice noodles in warm water for 20 minutes until soft.
  2. In a large skillet or wok, stir-fry shrimp or chicken with minced garlic over medium-high heat until cooked through.

  4. Add the soaked noodles to the skillet along with tamarind paste, fish sauce, and sugar; toss everything together until well combined.
  5. Stir in bean sprouts and cook for an additional minute.
  6. Serve hot, garnished with crushed peanuts and lime wedges.

⏱️ Prep Time: 120 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 10 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 130 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 12

📊 Difficulty: Medium

🥘 Ingredients

  • 3 1/2 cups flour
  • 1/4 cup sugar
  • 2 1/4 tsp active dry yeast
  • 3/4 cup warm milk
  • 2 eggs
  • 1/4 cup butter, melted
  • Jelly or jam for filling
  • Powdered sugar for dusting
  • Oil for frying

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Mix yeast with warm milk and sugar, let foam for 10 minutes.
  2. Add flour, eggs, and melted butter; knead until smooth.
  3. Let dough rise for 1 hour until doubled in size.
  4. Roll out dough and cut into circles; let rise for another 30 minutes.
  5. Deep fry at 350°F (175°C) until golden, about 2-3 minutes per side.
  6. Cool, then inject with jelly using a piping bag.
  7. Dust generously with powdered sugar before serving.

It's simple to prepare and packed with flavor, ensuring everyone will come back for seconds! | ⏱️ Prep: 15min | Cook: 50min | Serves: 4 | #cat1761230594885 #easyrecipe #recipe #cooking #foodie
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
⏱️ Prep Time: 15 minutes

🍳 Cook Time: 50 minutes

⏰ Total Time: 65 minutes

🍽️ Servings: 4

📊 Difficulty: Easy

🥘 Ingredients

  • 1 lb ground beef
  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 1 medium onion, chopped
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 4-5 medium potatoes, thinly sliced
  • 1 1/2 cups shredded cheddar cheese
  • 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
  • 1 teaspoon dried Italian seasoning
  • 1/2 teaspoon paprika
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1/2 cup beef broth or water
  • 1/4 cup milk (optional, for creaminess)
  • Fresh parsley for garnish (optional)

👩‍🍳 Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C) and grease a 9×13-inch baking dish with cooking spray or olive oil.
  2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
  3. Add the ground beef and cook, breaking it apart with a spoon, until browned and cooked through (about 5-7 minutes). Drain any excess fat if needed.
  4. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic to the skillet with the beef. Cook for another 3-4 minutes until the onion becomes soft and translucent.
  5. Layer the thinly sliced potatoes on top of the ground beef in the prepared baking dish. First, spread the cooked ground beef mixture evenly in the bottom of the dish.
  6. Then, arrange the potatoes on top, seasoning them with salt, pepper, Italian seasoning, and paprika.
  7. Sprinkle the shredded cheddar and grated Parmesan cheese over the beef.
  8. Pour the beef broth (or water) around the edges of the casserole to keep the potatoes moist while baking. Optionally, drizzle with milk for extra creaminess.
  9. Cover the casserole with aluminum foil and bake for 30 minutes.
  10. After 30 minutes, remove the foil and bake for an additional 15-20 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and the cheese is bubbly and golden.
  11. Garnish with fresh parsley if desired and serve hot!
